oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-10-28 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 28, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, the Crook Brothers, Zeke Clements, and Ford Rush. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Recording ends with the start of the following Opry segment.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Crook Brothers; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; Zeke Clements; Ford Rush; Golden West Cowboys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Roy Acuff performs "Answer To Sparkling Blue Eyes" [continued from part 1] / (2:13) George D. Hay introduces the Crook Brothers / (2:23) The Crook Brothers perform "Flop-Eared Mule" / (3:36) George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon / (3:56) Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon perform "Kissing On The Sly" / (5:55) George D. Hay introduces Zeke Clements / (6:10) Zeke Clements performs "Freight Train Blues" / (8:26) George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush / (8:50) Ford Rush performs "Beautiful Texas" / (11:00) George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff / (11:04) Roy Acuff performs "Crawdad Song" / (11:58) David Stone announces a Prince Albert commercial / (12:43) George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff / (12:50) Roy Acuff and cast perform "Soldier's Joy" / (13:44) George D. Hay and David Stone announce the closing statements / (14:49) Station announcements / (15:09) George D. Hay introduces the Golden West Cowboys / (15:16) The Golden West Cowboys perform "[Unconfirmed song]" [incomplete]
